programme.desc: A groovy use for blah bar stools. Make them into chic seating or even tables. Turn a tuna can into a trendy time piece.

programme.desc: Wendy takes you through some craft projects of the past.

programme.title: She's Crafty: Vixen Mixen
programme.desc: In this episode, revamp old bedside tables to create this va-va voom vanity. Transform tiles into coolio coasters with exo expert, Danny Sio.

programme.title: She's Crafty: Rock 'n' Roll Baby
programme.desc: Inspirational thoughts for the wall and a fabulous lavender eye pillow.

programme.title: She's Crafty: You Had Me At Craft
programme.desc: Add some sporty spice to your space with a tricked out skateboard table. Design up these mod mirrors to create a divide look for your wall. Plus flower power with style queen Brini Maxwell.

programme.desc: Learn how to make a scrap journal with Kathy!

programme.title: The Crafty Chica: Shadow Boxes

programme.title: Royal India: History of Ancestors
programme.desc: Samira visits a 300 year old fort and meets the royal owner who tells her stories of his ancestors and their history.

programme.title: Royal India: Arrival in Jaipur
programme.desc: Samira arrives at Jaipur where she visits a Royal medieval fort, and she prepares for her visit to see the city’s princess.

programme.title: Royal India: City Palace Jaipur and Its Princess
programme.desc: Samira arrives at the City Palace Jaipur, she sits down with one of India’s most fascinating royals, the Princess Diya Kumari.

programme.title: Royal India: Young Royals
programme.desc: Samira talks to the cousin of the Maharaja or Jodhpur, a young Royal who resides in his own palace close by, and then continues on her quest for true.

programme.title: Royal India: Rudyard Kipling
programme.desc: Discover the influence and impact of writer Rudyard Kipling on Royal India.

programme.title: Royal India: Royal Polo
programme.desc: Samira gets to play polo on the Royal polo fields and talks to the Maharaja about his love of the game. She also visits Mehrangarh fort.

programme.title: Royal India: Agra Recipes and Royal Dancing
programme.desc: Samira learns more royal recipes in Agra and a Royal dance that once graced the courts of kings going back to the 17th century.
